bean.description: Standalone server, for running within or outside of a (J2EE) container.

property.name: binding
property.description: So that the server can install the appropriate runtime binding. This isn't hard-coded because the binding depends on the domainBuilder, shared with the 'domain' (domain definition).

property.name: remotingServer
property.description: So that the remoting server can be started and stopped as a subcomponent of the standalone server overall.

property.name: objectStoreRouting
property.description: So that the server can set up the routing on behalf of the transactionProcessor (that shares this routing object).

property.name: serverSessionFactories
property.description: Primarily to populate 'objectStoreRouting', but the server also instruct the factory to initialize itself (meaning register classes in a manner appropriate to the databaser server that it references). The server also takes responsibility for starting/shutdown of the database server that the factory references (a transitive dependency). Each factory (implementing IServerSessionFactory) is keyed by an SessionBinding; this is derived from the combination of the (IDomain corresponding to the) domainDefinition property and the databaseServer.databaseName property.

property.name: properties
property.description: There is no need to provide hibernate.connection.driver_class, hibernate.connection.url, hibernate.connection.username and hibernate.connection.password because these are provided by the serverSessionFactory's reference to the database server

property.name: primaryBuilder
property.description: The IDomainBuilder to delegate to when interacting with the domain objects. In theory the domain plugin could redefine the 'primaryBuilder' bean, though this will be rare.

bean.description: Default definition of 'primaryBuilder', representing the programming model conventions under which the domain classes have been written. The domain plugin could in theory redefine this bean, though this will be rare.

property.name: domainBuilder
property.description: The programming model conventions under which the domain classes were written.
